author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Thanks for making this package! A note on the name, Julia packages almost always use UpperCammelCase. In this case, `MORWiki` is the standard capitalization of this name (much like the `Base.IOBuffer` type).

If you rename your package to `MORWiki.jl` folks who are used to Julia package naming conventions will be able to remember and guess it's name much more easily.

I thought about this, too. In fact, the first draft of the package was named that way. However, the preferred way to cite the MOR Wiki is "MORwiki" (https://morwiki.mpi-magdeburg.mpg.de/morwiki/index.php/MOR_Wiki:About). I don't have a strong opinion, but would prefer if package and preferred citation are the same. Let me discuss this internally and get back to you afterwards.
Superseeded by #105655 ... how do I close this PR?
You can't do that yourself, but declaring it to be ready to be closed is helpful.
